title: Prepare for release 0.11.1-rc1.
Exclude ui feature for docs.rs.
Don’t include unnecessary files in Cargo package.
body: Fixes #633

title: Dump the stored trust anchor certificates.
body:
This copies all certificate stored under $(REPOSITORY_DIR)/store/ta to
$(TARGET_DIR)/ta using the same structure as the store itself. The
somewhat unexpected organization has been documented in the manual.

Fixes #722.

title: Bubble up error in server main loop.
body:
This will cause the process to `exit(1)` instead of pretending all is well.

Fixes #674.

title: Truncate PID file upon opening.
body: Fixes #734.

title: Add commas where needed on the delta-json output.
body: Fixes #727.

title: Also set TCP_KEEPIDLE when enable TCP keepalive.
body: This will be set to `rtr-tcp-keepalive` in order to overwrite the OS’s default value which, in case of Linux, is 7200 seconds.

title: When dumping RRDP, don’t copy the hash at the beginning of objects.
body: Fixes #733.

title: Prepare for release 0.11.0.
Prepare for release 0.11.0-rc2.
Improve killing of timed out rsync processes.
body:
When just dropping the Tokio child process object, the process is not
properly being waited for and may become a zombie. By explicitely
calling kill and awaiting the result, this shouldn’t happen.

title: Change media of /log to plain text.
body: This was accidentally set to JSON.

title: Describe supported archs
body: This PR should capture what architectures and OSes we currently support

title: Fixes to DEB and RPM packaging
body:
The v0.11.0-rc1 release had incorrect version numbers on the RPM packages. They should have been `0.11.0~rc1` but were `0.11.0-rc1` meaning that our packaging system published them in the `main` package repo instead of the `proposed` package repo (where release candidates are supposed to be published). Anyone who upgraded packages with `yum` who had an older Routinator RPM installed will have been prompted to install (or if `-y` was used will have installed) the RC version even if they didn't have the `proposed` repo configured.

This PR fixes the versioning issue, and a separate PR on the packaging system itself adds a check to prevent publication of mixed proposed and non-proposed packages to prevent such a mistake getting to the final package repos.

This PR also fixes a couple of other packaging issues discovered at the same time. Firstly the GitHub Actions cache wrongly contained the `target` directory, other versions of our packaging workflow (e.g. the one for Krill) don't have this. With this a previous run that generated one RPM filename can fetch that RPM back from the cache on a subsequent run and then fail because it produces two RPMs unexpectedly instead of one. It could probably also fail in more interesting and painful ways.

Secondly, it also fixes the tag URL in the DEB package `debian/changelog` file to use the actual Git tag without a minus sign instead of a tilda (as the tilda is only in the package version, not in the application version).

title: Prepare for release 0.11.0-rc1.
Update dependencies.
Add a --more-specifics option to the vrps command.
body: Fixes #708.

title: Fix json-delta path in man path.
body: Fixes #662.

title: README overhaul
body: The README had grown unwieldy. This PR shortens it to describing the essentials, and pointing to the documentation for details.

title: Enable TCP keep alive on RTR sockets if configured.
body: Fixes #320. Again.

title: Bring back systemd socket activation.
body: This was lost some versions ago for some reason. Fixes #639.

title: Various changes to the HTTP server.
body:
* Makes the (standard) JSON payload output available under `/api/v1/origins` with the same URL parameters. Fixes #591.
* Adds a new URI parameter `include=more-specifics` to all payload output paths to include all route origins for prefixes that are more specifics of the selected prefixes. Fixes #592.
* Accepts and processes HEAD requests for all HTTP paths. Fixes #704.
* Introduces a new response builder that makes it unnecessary to unwrap when finishing a response.

title: Divide installation and compilation docs
body: Instead of interspersing Debian/RPM packages and Cargo, separate them out into their own pages. Also, merge the Installation Notes page with the Cargo instructions and move `tmpfs` to Configuration.

title: Switch to the vault package repository for CentOS 8 now that it is EOL.
body:
This PR "fixes" the failing CentOS 8 packaging workflow ([see here](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/1778642751)) by telling CentOS 8 to use vault packages as there are no "current" packages now that it is EOL. This will presumably allow anyone still running CentOS 8 to install a Routinator package.

Note: This PR doesn't attempt to address the separate question of whether or not it makes sense to keep packaging for CentOS 8 or if we should package instead or additionally for Rocky Linux, for example (and whether or not we would need to also extend packages.nlnetlabs.nl with a separate RockyLinux repository as well).

A successful run of the packaging workflow using the changes in this PR can be seen [here](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/1786566863).

title: Add "slurm" output format.
body: Fixes #696

title: Sort TALs by name.
body: The PR sorts the list of TALs after loading by their name. This will make them appear in alphabetical order both in the summary as well as in status and metrics.

title: Change log wording for warn unsafe_vrps policy.
body:
Previously, the log message said it was filtering unsafe VRPs, even if
it didn’t. It now says ‘encountered.’

Additionally, if the policy is accept, we now don’t count the VRP for
the metrics anymore.

Fixes #671.

title: Wrap RwLock and Mutex to avoid having to unwrap all the time.
Document advanced features
body: This page documents features that have to be built or enabled explicitly.

title: Add .dockerignore
body: Don't send potentially large unnecessary directory contents to the Docker daemon when building the Docker image

title: Add support for router keys.
body:
This PR adds support for BGPsec router keys.

Since there is hardly any practical experience with router keys appearing in RPKI payload sets, the feature will be disabled by default and needs to be switched on via the new `enable-bgpsec` command line or config file option.

Output of router keys has been added to the jsonext format. The other formats will remain unchanged for now. In a follow-up PR we will add JSON output using the SLURM specification (#696).

title: TlsTcpStream mustn’t crash after a failed TLS handshake.
body:
Hyper still does a clean shutdown via AsyncWrite::flush and
AsyncWrite::shutdown after receiving an error upon reading or writing.
So we still need to pretend that the socket works after the error even
if we don’t actually do anything.

Fixes #691.

title: Correctly determine premature manifests.
Docs for native TLS support
body: Describing the new `rtr-tls` and `http-tls` options

title: Attribute the DEB changelog entry to RPKI team.
body:
For context the DEB info says this: (using an RTR DEB as an example as I have it unpacked already in front of me but it's the same for Routinator):

```
$ dpkg --info ~/Downloads/rtrtr_0.2.0-1bullseye_amd64.deb   | grep Maintainer
 Maintainer: The NLnet Labs RPKI Team <rpki@nlnetlabs.nl>
```

But the embedded mandatory changelog file contains this:

```
$ zcat tmp/usr/share/doc/rtrtr/changelog.Debian.gz 
rtrtr (0.2.0) unstable; urgency=medium
  * See: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/rtrtr/releases/tag/v0.2.0
 -- maintainer partim <hn@nvnc.de>  Wed, 19 Jan 2022 10:09:11 +0000
```

title: Remove reference in DEB packaging to removed `doc/misc.md` file.
Debian ARM packaging
body:
Initial attempt, not tested locally.

Supports the `armhf` (ARMv7 e.g. Raspberry Pi 4b) and `aarch64` (ARM64 e.g. Rock64) targets.

title: Docs cleanup
body: Final cleanup before release.

title: Remove duplicate argument passed to `useradd` in the RPM `postinst` script.
Count collected valid CRLs.
body: Fixes #645.

title: Don’t complain when trying to delete non-existing directories.
body: Fixes #643.

title: Reject premature manifests.
body:
Manifests are considered premature if their thisUpdate timestamp is
before the current time. Internet draft draft-ietf-sidrops-6486bis added
a requirement to reject such manifests. This PR adds this requirement.

A new state "premature" has been added to the manifest Prometheus
metrics. Similarly, a new prematureManifests counter has been added to
the JSON metrics.

Fixes #589.

title: User manual merge
body: This PR merges all the content from the [routinator-manual ](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator-manual )project, including history.

title: Switch to using payload types from rpki 0.14.
body:
This PR contains the changes necessary to upgrade to _rpki_ 0.14.

Most importantly, we are now using `rpki::rtr::payload::Payload` everywhere. Since that type also includes BGPsec router keys, it includes a number of preparations for router key support. However, at this point we still only support route origins.

The PR also switches SLURM support to the types provided by the _rpki_ crate. There should be no consequences from that.

Before it can be merged, I would like to add a bunch of test cases to at least the `payload` to make sure the changes didn’t break anything.

title: TLS support in RTR and HTTP server.
body:
This PR adds TLS support to both the RTR and HTTP server. It add six new configuration variables:

*  `rtr-tls-listen` and `http-tls-listen` (available as `--rtr-tls` and `--http-tls` command line options, respectively) list the socket addresses to listen on,
* `rtr-tls-key` and `http-tls-key` provide the path to the file containing the private keys, and
* `rtr-tls-cert` and `http-tls-cert` provide the path to the file containing the server certificate.

This PR requires an upgrade of the minimum supported Rust version to 1.52 and therefore includes breaking changes.

Fixes #442, fixes #516.

title: Cope with stray files in the rsync collector’s directory.
body: Fixes #673.

title: Upgrade to actions/checkout v2 to avoid potential security issue (see nlnetlabs/krill#746)
Prepare for release 0.10.2.
Remove support for gzip transfer encoding in RRDP client.
body:
This PR removes support for the gzip transfer encoding from the Routinator RRDP client.

The immediate reason is that the XML parser we are using happily reads data into memory until it finds the first < (which is backed by the XML spec) which makes it susceptible to an gzip bomb. However, even if that were fixed, it is far too easy to make a gzip’d XML file with lots and lots of white-space somewhere which would be entirely legal but significantly slow down processing.

So, as this sounds like a potentially bottomless can of worms, we are going to disable support for gzip.

This PR fixes CVE-2021-43174.

title: Set RRDP timeout on each request.
body:
This is yet another attempt to get the RRDP timeout right. It seems that the global timeout on the HTTP client limits the length of individual read or write operations (much like the similar timeout in rsync). However, there is a timeout that can be set for each request that actually limits how long the processing the complete request may take. This PR changes the RRDP collector to set the timeout this way – which seems to work.

This PR fixes CVE-2021-43173.

title: Limit the depth of CAs via max-ca-depth config variable.
body:
This PR limits the maximum distance a CA may have from a trust anchor certificate via the new max-ca-depth config variable which defaults to 32.

This PR fixes CVE-2021-43172.

title: Code improvements based on nightly Clippy.
Update the NLnet Labs testbed TAL to match the new one used by the server.
body: Fixes #636.
